summary: An ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 21009 entitled: "An ordinance providing for the laying off, opening, widening, extending and establishing of 46th Avenue South, from Pearl Street to Dawson Street, in the City of Seattle; providing for the condemnation, appropriation, taking and damaging of land and other property necessary therefor and providing that the cost of said improvement shall be paid by special assessment upon the property specially benefited in the manner provided by law" approved the 2nd day of June, 1909.
